title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Contributing to camtraptor
text: Think camtraptor useful? Let others discover , telling person, via Twitter blog post. Using camtraptor paper writing? Consider citing . Still, package test environment contribute improve existent packages, camtrapR.

title: Contributing to camtraptor
text: Using camtraptor got stuck? Browse documentation see can find solution. Still stuck? Post question issue GitHub. offer user support, â€™ll try best address , questions often lead better documentation discovery bugs. Want ask question private? Contact package maintainer email.

title: Contributing to camtraptor
text: idea new camtraptor feature? Take look documentation issue list see isnâ€™t included suggested yet. , suggest idea issue GitHub. canâ€™t promise implement idea, helps : Explain detail work. Keep scope narrow possible. See want contribute code idea well.

title: Contributing to camtraptor
text: Using camtraptor discovered bug? â€™s annoying! Donâ€™t let others experience report issue GitHub can fix . good bug report makes easier us , please include: operating system name version (e.g.Â Mac OS 10.13.6). details local setup might helpful troubleshooting. Detailed steps reproduce bug.

text: Care fix bugs implement new functionality camtraptor? Awesome! ðŸ‘ look issue list leave comment things want work . See also development guidelines .

title: Contributing to camtraptor
text: try follow GitHub flow development. Fork repo clone computer. learn process, see guide. forked cloned project since worked , pull changes original repo clone using git pull upstream master. Open RStudio project file (.Rproj). Write code. Test code (bonus points adding unit tests). Document code (see function documentation ). R CMD check using devtools::check() aim 0 errors warnings. Commit push changes. Submit pull request.

title: Camera operation matrix
text: Load packages: loading package camtraptor, camera trap data package called mica made available. data package contains camera trap data musk rats coypus. use variable now .
code: library(camtraptor) library(lubridate) #>  #> Attaching package: 'lubridate' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     date, intersect, setdiff, union library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

title: Camera operation matrix
text: can create camera operation matrix passing camera trap data package: function read deployments slot data package create matrix. matrix rows location names, default values field locationName deployments. Column names dates. matrix values : 0 station active, integer (1 ) one deployments linked station fully active whole day decimal value partially active stations. example one--one relation deployments locations: daily effort 0 1. example show happens four deployments set location (B_DL_val 5_beek kleine vijver) active days: example simulate location (B_DM_val 4_'t WAD) linked two deployments active two different periods: results following camera operation matrix:

title: Camera operation matrix
text: can specify column containing station names instead using default locationName. example use column locationID. small preview matrix shown: can also decide use prefix "Station" station names done camtrapRâ€™s cameraOperation() setting use_prefix = TRUE. small preview entire matrix shown:
code: cam_op_with_locationID <- get_cam_op(mica, station_col = "locationID") cam_op_with_locationID[1:4, 1:2] #>                                      2019-10-09 2019-10-10 #> 2df5259b-b4b4-4f43-8cf7-effcced06d6f         NA         NA #> ff1535c0-6b5d-44be-b3ef-c4d4204dad74         NA         NA #> ce943ced-1bcf-4140-9a2e-e8ee5e8c10e6         NA         NA #> 3232bcfd-5dfa-496e-b7ab-14593bb1b7f1  0.5290856          1 cam_op_with_prefix <- get_cam_op(mica, use_prefix = TRUE) cam_op_with_prefix[1:4,1:2] #>                                      2019-10-09 2019-10-10 #> StationB_DL_val 5_beek kleine vijver         NA         NA #> StationB_DL_val 3_dikke boom                 NA         NA #> StationB_DM_val 4_'t WAD                     NA         NA #> StationMica Viane                     0.5290856          1

title: Camera operation matrix
text: can specify column containing camera IDs added station names following camtrapRâ€™s convention: Station__CAM_CameraID. row names shown: cans also add session IDs using session_col argument, following camtrapRâ€™s convention: Station__SESS_sessionID: use camera session IDs, camtrapRâ€™s convention Station__SESS_SessionID__CAM_CameraID followed:
code: mica_cameras <- mica mica_cameras$data$deployments$cameraID <- c(1, 2, 3, 4) cam_op_with_camera_ids <- get_cam_op(mica_cameras, camera_col = "cameraID") row.names(cam_op_with_camera_ids) #> [1] "B_DL_val 5_beek kleine vijver__CAM_1" #> [2] "B_DL_val 3_dikke boom__CAM_2"         #> [3] "B_DM_val 4_'t WAD__CAM_3"             #> [4] "Mica Viane__CAM_4" mica_sessions <- mica mica_sessions$data$deployments$session <- c(1, 2, 3, 4) cam_op_with_session_ids <- get_cam_op(mica_sessions, session_col = "session") row.names(cam_op_with_session_ids) #> [1] "B_DL_val 5_beek kleine vijver__SESS_1" #> [2] "B_DL_val 3_dikke boom__SESS_2"         #> [3] "B_DM_val 4_'t WAD__SESS_3"             #> [4] "Mica Viane__SESS_4" mica_sessions$data$deployments$cameraID <- c(1, 2, 3, 4) cam_op_with_session_and_camera_ids <- get_cam_op(   mica_sessions,    camera_col = "cameraID",   session_col = "session" ) row.names(cam_op_with_session_and_camera_ids) #> [1] "B_DL_val 5_beek kleine vijver__SESS_1__CAM_1" #> [2] "B_DL_val 3_dikke boom__SESS_2__CAM_2"         #> [3] "B_DM_val 4_'t WAD__SESS_3__CAM_3"             #> [4] "Mica Viane__SESS_4__CAM_4"

text: Load packages: loading package camtraptor, camera trap data package called mica made available. data package contains camera trap data musk rats coypus. use variable now .
code: library(camtraptor) library(lubridate) #>  #> Attaching package: 'lubridate' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     date, intersect, setdiff, union library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

title: Filter predicates
text: filter predicates functions starting pred prefix. can distinguished four categories based type inputs accept: one argument, one value one argument, value one argument, multiple values (vector) multiple predicates called filter predicates build (dplyr) filter statement. Filter predicates return objects class filter_predicate, particular kind list following slots: arg, argument value, value type, type filter predicate expr, filter dplyr expression

title: Filter predicates
text: filter predicates accept one argument one value.

previous_headings: Filter predicates > One argument - one value predicates
title: Filter predicates
text: pred() basic predicates refers equality statements. Example, want select rows column equal 5: opposite operator pred() (equals) pred_not (notEquals):
code: pred(arg = "a", value = 5) #> $arg #> [1] "a" #>  #> $value #> [1] 5 #>  #> $type #> [1] "equals" #>  #> $expr #> (a == 5) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_not(arg = "a", value = 5) #> $arg #> [1] "a" #>  #> $value #> [1] 5 #>  #> $type #> [1] "notEquals" #>  #> $expr #> (a != 5) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"

previous_headings: Filter predicates > One argument - one value predicates
title: Filter predicates
text: predicates express > (greaterThan), >= (greaterThanOrEqual),< (lessThan) <= (lessThanOrEqual) respectively. Example: want select rows column greater 5:
code: pred_gt(arg = "a", value = 5) #> $arg #> [1] "a" #>  #> $value #> [1] 5 #>  #> $type #> [1] "greaterThan" #>  #> $expr #> (a > 5) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"

title: Filter predicates
text: predicate pred_na() compares argument NA. select rows column NA: select rows NA, can use opposite predicate pred_notna():
code: pred_na(arg = "a") #> $arg #> [1] "a" #>  #> $value #> [1] NA #>  #> $type #> [1] "na" #>  #> $expr #> (is.na(a)) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_notna(arg = "a") #> $arg #> [1] "a" #>  #> $value #> [1] NA #>  #> $type #> [1] "notNa" #>  #> $expr #> (!is.na(a)) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"

title: Filter predicates
text: predicates accept vector multiple values argument. get rows column one values c(1,3,5): opposite pred_in() pred_notin():
code: pred_in(arg = "a", value = c(1,3,5)) #> $arg #> [1] "a" #>  #> $value #> [1] 1 3 5 #>  #> $type #> [1] "in" #>  #> $expr #> (a %in% c(1,3,5)) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_notin(arg = "a", value = c(1,3,5)) #> $arg #> [1] "a" #>  #> $value #> [1] 1 3 5 #>  #> $type #> [1] "notIn" #>  #> $expr #> (!(a %in% c(1,3,5))) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"

title: Filter predicates
text: can combine predicates described make complex filter statements using pred_and() (operator) pred_or() (operator). examples. Select rows column equal 5 column b NA: Select rows column equal 5 column b NA: Notice two predicates return filter_predicate objects structure predicate, slots arg, value type long number input predicates combine.

title: Filter predicates
text: shown , can combine several predicates complex filtering. E.g. calculate number species detected deployments one location names B_ML_val 06_Oostpolderkreek B_ML_val 07_Sint-Anna, deployments south 50.7 degrees: syntax valid visualizing information via map_dep() function: Notice also can pass much predicates want get_*() functions map_dep() separating comma: combined internally using operator. E.g. get effort deployments southern 51 degrees eastern 4 degrees, can simplify : omitting pred_and(): similar behaviour dplyrâ€™s filter() function, : exactly : Happy filtering!
code: get_n_species(mica,               pred_or(                 pred_in("locationName",                         c("B_DL_val 5_beek kleine vijver", "B_DL_val 3_dikke boom")),                 pred_lt("latitude", 50.7))) #> df %>% dplyr::filter(((locationName %in% c("B_DL_val 5_beek kleine vijver","B_DL_val 3_dikke boom")) | (latitude < 50.7))) #> # text: features must used combination species name, â€™s sometimes useful idea first species detected correspondent vernacular names present:
code: get_species(mica) #> # A tibble: 9 Ã— 5 #>   taxonID taxonIDReference  scientificName vernacularNames.en vernacularNames.nl #>   <chr>   <chr>             <chr>          <chr>              <chr>              #> 1 DGP6    https://www.cataâ€¦ Anas platyrhyâ€¦ mallard            wilde eend         #> 2 DGPL    https://www.cataâ€¦ Anas strepera  gadwall            krakeend           #> 3 32FH    https://www.cataâ€¦ Ardea          great herons       reigers            #> 4 GCHS    https://www.cataâ€¦ Ardea cinerea  grey heron         blauwe reiger      #> 5 RQPW    https://www.cataâ€¦ Castor fiber   Eurasian beaver    bever              #> 6 6MB3T   https://www.cataâ€¦ Homo sapiens   human              mens               #> 7 3Y9VW   https://www.cataâ€¦ Martes foina   beech marten       steenmarter        #> 8 44QYC   https://www.cataâ€¦ Mustela putorâ€¦ European polecat   bunzing            #> 9 5BSG3   https://www.cataâ€¦ Vulpes vulpes  red fox            vos

title: Visualize deployment features
text: can visualize number species detected deployment using function map_dep() feature argument set n_species:
code: map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_species")

title: Visualize deployment features
text: visualize number observations, set feature = n_obs: can also specify species want calculate number observations: Notice zero values also visualized specific icon ease detection. default black multiplication symbol Ã—. can filter sex: life stage:
code: map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_obs") map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_obs",         species = "Anas platyrhynchos") #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   species = "Anas platyrhynchos",   sex = c("female", "unknown") ) #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = c("unknown", "subadult") ) #> There are 2 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7

title: Visualize deployment features
text: visualize number observed individuals, set feature = n_individuals: observations, can specify species: filter sex /life stage:
code: map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_individuals") map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_individuals",         species = "Anas platyrhynchos") #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(   mica,   "n_individuals",   species = "Anas platyrhynchos",   sex = c("female", "unknown") ) #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7

title: Visualize deployment features
text: visualize Relative Abundance Index (RAI) species, set feature = rai specify species using scientific name: Notice package RAI normalized deployment activity period 100 days. number observations number individuals, can filter sex /life stage: Common names allowed values species well: Values species also interpreted case insensitive: species specified wrong, informative error message listing valid values returned:
code: map_dep(mica,         feature = "rai",         species = "Anas platyrhynchos") #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(   mica,   "rai",   species = "Anas platyrhynchos",   sex = c("female", "unknown") ) #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(mica,         feature = "rai",         species = "great herons") #> Scientific name of great herons: Ardea #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8, 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(mica,         feature = "rai",         species = "CastoR FIBer") #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(mica,           feature = "rai",           species = "This is not a species name") #> Error: Invalid value for species parameter: this is not a species name. #> Valid inputs are: anas platyrhynchos, anas strepera, ardea, ardea cinerea, castor fiber, homo sapiens, martes foina, mustela putorius, vulpes vulpes, mallard, gadwall, great herons, grey heron, eurasian beaver, human, beech marten, european polecat, red fox, wilde eend, krakeend and others...

title: Visualize deployment features
text: can also visualize RAI based number detected individuals instead standard RAI based number observations. Set feature = "rai_individuals": Everything described previous section visualizing RAI holds true RAI based individuals well.
code: map_dep(mica,         feature = "rai_individuals",         species = "Anas platyrhynchos") #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7

title: Visualize deployment features
text: Visualize duration deployments, also called effort, number active hours: using days time unit months
code: map_dep(mica,          feature = "effort",         effort_unit = "hour") map_dep(mica,          feature = "effort",         effort_unit = "day") map_dep(mica,          feature = "effort",         effort_unit = "month")

title: Visualize deployment features
text: can specify information want show hovering mouse deployment. can choose among columns deployments (see allowed fields camera trap data package standard documentation) n (number species, number observations RAI). lat/lon, camera height tags shown hovering: Deactivating cluster mode hovering also possible:
code: map_dep(mica,         hover_columns = c("latitude",                           "longitude",                           "cameraHeight",                           "tags"),         feature = "n_obs" ) map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_species",          cluster = FALSE,         hover_columns = NULL)

title: Visualize deployment features
text: can happen deployments didnâ€™t detected recognizable animal (scientificName = NA) didnâ€™t observe anything (deployments observations). visualizing number species, two situations shown default red black multiplication symbols Ã— respectively. message deployment zero observations also returned R console:
code: # create data package with one deployment with 0 obs and one delpoyment with # observations of unknown species unknown_species_vs_no_obs <- mica unknown_species_vs_no_obs$data$observations <-    unknown_species_vs_no_obs$data$observations %>%    # a deployment has detected only unknown species   filter(is.na(.data$scientificName) |             .data$scientificName != "Homo sapiens") %>%   # a deployment has no observations   filter(deploymentID != "62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1") # create new map map_dep(unknown_species_vs_no_obs,         feature = "n_species") #> There are 1 deployments without observations: 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1

title: Visualize deployment features
text: default color palette viridis color palette called "inferno". can specify another viridis color palette, e.g.Â "viridis" "magma", RColorBrewer palette, e.g.Â "BuPu" "Oranges". use viridis color palette: can use palette RColorBrewer, e.g.Â "BuPu" palette: Another easy way specify palette create passing vector colors names hex colors, e.g.Â c("black", "blue", "#A3675F"):
code: map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   palette = "viridis" ) map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   palette = "BuPu" ) map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   palette = c("black", "blue", "#A3675F") )

what: Use a specific icon and color for zero values
title: Visualize deployment features
text: can pass zero_value_icon_url argument URL icon zero_values_icon_size size pixels icon. several icon libraries can choose . library many free icons icons8. , example icon Fry Futurama animation series icon size 50: Typically colour part URL. two examples change color default icon green (2ECC71): INBO fuchsia (#C04384): Modifying default value ("black") can useful color deployments zero values can sometimes similar one colors used palette.
code: map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = "subadult",   zero_values_icon_url = "https://img.icons8.com/color/48/000000/futurama-fry.png",   zero_values_icon_size = 50 ) #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = "subadult",   zero_values_icon_url =      "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/2ECC71/multiply.png" ) #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = "subadult",   zero_values_icon_url =      "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/C04384/multiply.png" ) #> There are 3 deployments without observations: 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372, 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 and 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7

title: Visualize deployment features
text: can also modify upper lower limit circle sizes specifying radius_range (default: c(10,50):
code: map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_obs",         radius_range = c(20, 150))

title: Visualize deployment features
text: default upper limit color palette radius defined based actual feature values. However, sometimes can useful set absolute upper limit. can done setting argument relative_scale FALSE specifying upper limit max_scale. Upper limit lower number observations: Upper limit higher number observations:
code: map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_obs",         relative_scale = FALSE,         max_scale = 2) map_dep(mica,         feature = "n_obs",         relative_scale = FALSE,         max_scale = 50)

title: Visualize deployment features
text: maybe like visualize deployment information subset deployments. , can use filter predicates. E.g. visualize number observations deployments longitude equal higher 5.6: filter predicates filter predicates article.
code: map_dep(mica,         pred_gt("longitude", 5.6),         feature = "n_obs") #> df %>% dplyr::filter((longitude > 5.6))

what: Read, Explore and Visualize Camera Trap Data Packages
title: Read, Explore and Visualize Camera Trap Data Packages
text: Camtraptor R package read, explore visualize Camera Trap Data Packages (Camtrap DP). Camtrap DP community developed data exchange format type data. camtraptor can read filter data, create overviews observed species, relative abundance effort, plot data map.

title: Read, Explore and Visualize Camera Trap Data Packages
text: Camtraptor currently uses legacy Camtrap DP 0.1.6 internal data model. read_camtrap_dp() automatically -convert Camtrap DP 1.0 datasets legacy model avoid introducing breaking changes. downside newer properties like deployments.cameraDepth, media.filePublic observations.eventEnd removed reading data. upcoming camtraptor v1.0 update internal data model Camtrap DP 1.0 drop support Camtrap DP 0.1.6. breaking change accompanied number major changes. Future versions camtraptor always use latest version Camtrap DP -convert legacy datasets model.

title: Read, Explore and Visualize Camera Trap Data Packages
text: get started, see: Vignettes: tutorials showcasing functionality. Function reference: overview functions.

title: Read, Explore and Visualize Camera Trap Data Packages

code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("inbo/camtraptor")

title: Calculate animal position â€” calc_animal_pos
text: Calculates position animal relative camera based image pixel positions site calibration models.

title: Calculate animal position â€” calc_animal_pos
code: calc_animal_pos(   animal_pos,   calib_models,   dep_tag = "deploymentID",   sequence_id = "sequenceID",   x = "x",   y = "y",   image_width = "imageWidth",   image_height = "imageHeight" )

title: Calculate animal position â€” calc_animal_pos
text: animal_pos Data frame (tibble) animal position digitization data. must contain (least) columns defined args dep_tag, sequence_id, x, y, image_width image_height. calib_models Named list deployment calibration models site calibration models (calibs objects), produced using cal.site() (yet included package). deployment names used names. dep_tag Column animal_pos names elements can matched apply right deployment calibration models. Default: "deploymentID". sequence_id Column animal_pos containing sequence ID images belong . Default: "sequenceID". x Column animal_pos containing x pixel positions digitised point. Default: "x". y Column animal_pos containing y pixel positions digitised point. Default: "y". image_width Column animal_pos containing pixel x dimension image. Default: "imageWidth". Notice pixel x dimension must consistent deployment. image_height Column animal_pos containing pixel y dimension image. Default: "imageHeight". Notice pixel y dimension must consistent deployment.

title: Calculate animal position â€” calc_animal_pos
text: Original tibble data frame passed via animal_pos additional columns: radius: Radial distance camera. angle: Angular distance camera. frame_count: Indicator frame order within sequence.

title: Check scientific or vernacular name(s) â€” check_species
text: character vector correspondent scientific names.

title: Check scientific or vernacular name(s) â€” check_species
code: # Species is a scientific name check_species(mica, "Martes foina") #> [1] "Martes foina"  # Species is a vector of vernacular names check_species(mica, c("beech marten", "european polecat")) #> Scientific name of beech marten: Martes foina #> Scientific name of european polecat: Mustela putorius #> [1] "Martes foina"     "Mustela putorius"  # Vernacular names can be specified in any language available check_species(mica, c("vos", "blauwe reiger")) #> Scientific name of vos: Vulpes vulpes #> Scientific name of blauwe reiger: Ardea cinerea #> [1] "Vulpes vulpes" "Ardea cinerea"  # Vernacular names and scientific names can be mixed up check_species(mica, c("beech marten", "blauwe reiger", "Anas strepera")) #> Scientific name of beech marten: Martes foina #> Scientific name of blauwe reiger: Ardea cinerea #> [1] "Martes foina"  "Ardea cinerea" "Anas strepera"  # Case insensitive check_species(mica, "AnaS StrePeRa") #> [1] "Anas strepera" check_species(mica, "bEEch mARteN") #> Scientific name of bEEch mARteN: Martes foina #> [1] "Martes foina"  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ check_species(mica, "bad name") } # }

code: pred(arg, value)  pred_not(arg, value)  pred_gt(arg, value)  pred_gte(arg, value)  pred_lt(arg, value)  pred_lte(arg, value)  pred_in(arg, value)  pred_notin(arg, value)  pred_na(arg)  pred_notna(arg)  pred_and(...)  pred_or(...)

title: Filter predicate â€” pred
text: arg (character) key predicate. See "Keys" . value (various) value predicate. ... pred_or() pred_and(): one objects class filter_predicate, created pred* function.

title: Filter predicate â€” pred
text: predicate object. object class predicate list following elements: arg: (list ) character arguments predicate(s). value: (list ) character values predicate(s). type: (list ) character predicate types, see section "predicate methods" . expr: character: body filter expression.

what: Predicate methods and their equivalent types
title: Filter predicate â€” pred
text: pred* functions named 'type' operation , inspired GBIF occurrence predicates following functions take one key one value associated following types: pred: equals pred_not: notEquals pred_lt: lessThan pred_lte: lessThanOrEquals pred_gt: greaterThan pred_gte: greaterThanOrEquals pred_like: like (IMPLEMENTED YET!) following function geospatial queries, accepts WKT string: pred_within: within (IMPLEMENTED YET!) following functions stating () want key NA, accepts one key: pred_na: isNA pred_notna: isNotNA following two functions accept multiple individual filter predicates, separating either "" "": pred_and: pred_or: following function special accepts single key many values, stating want search listed values, e.g. one locations : "B_ML_val 05_molenkreek", "B_ML_val 03_De Val" "B_ML_val 06_Oostpolderkreek" pred_in: pred_notin: notIn

title: Filter predicate â€” pred
text: Internally, input pred* functions turn character string, forms body filter expression. example: pred("tags", "boven de stroom") gives:   pred_gt("latitude", 51.27) gives, (expr element shown):   pred_or() gives:   pred_or() gives:
code: $arg [1] "tags"  $value [1] "boven de stroom"  $type [1] "equals"  $expr (tags == "boven de stroom") (latitude > 51.27) ((tags == "boven de stroom") | (latitude > 51.28)) ((tags == "boven de stroom") & (latitude > 51.28))

title: Filter predicate â€” pred
text: Acceptable arguments key parameter column names data frame applying filter predicates.

title: Filter predicate â€” pred
code: # One arg one value predicates pred("scientificName", "Anas platyrhynchos") #> $arg #> [1] "scientificName" #>  #> $value #> [1] "Anas platyrhynchos" #>  #> $type #> [1] "equals" #>  #> $expr #> (scientificName == "Anas platyrhynchos") #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred("tags", "boven de stroom") #> $arg #> [1] "tags" #>  #> $value #> [1] "boven de stroom" #>  #> $type #> [1] "equals" #>  #> $expr #> (tags == "boven de stroom") #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_gt("latitude", 51.18) #> $arg #> [1] "latitude" #>  #> $value #> [1] 51.18 #>  #> $type #> [1] "greaterThan" #>  #> $expr #> (latitude > 51.18) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_gte("latitude", 51.18) #> $arg #> [1] "latitude" #>  #> $value #> [1] 51.18 #>  #> $type #> [1] "greaterThanOrEquals" #>  #> $expr #> (latitude >= 51.18) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_lt("longitude", 3.95) #> $arg #> [1] "longitude" #>  #> $value #> [1] 3.95 #>  #> $type #> [1] "lessThan" #>  #> $expr #> (longitude < 3.95) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_lte("longitude", 3.95) #> $arg #> [1] "longitude" #>  #> $value #> [1] 3.95 #>  #> $type #> [1] "lessThanOrEquals" #>  #> $expr #> (longitude <= 3.95) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_not("locationName", "B_DL_val 3_dikke boom") #> $arg #> [1] "locationName" #>  #> $value #> [1] "B_DL_val 3_dikke boom" #>  #> $type #> [1] "notEquals" #>  #> $expr #> (locationName != "B_DL_val 3_dikke boom") #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"  # and/or predicates pred_and(pred_lt("longitude", 3.59), pred_gt("latitude", 51.28)) #> $arg #> $arg[[1]] #> [1] "longitude" #>  #> $arg[[2]] #> [1] "latitude" #>  #>  #> $value #> $value[[1]] #> [1] 3.59 #>  #> $value[[2]] #> [1] 51.28 #>  #>  #> $type #> $type[[1]] #> [1] "lessThan" #>  #> $type[[2]] #> [1] "greaterThan" #>  #>  #> $expr #> ((longitude < 3.59) & (latitude > 51.28)) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_or(pred_gte("count", 2), pred("vernacular_name", "Norway Rat")) #> $arg #> $arg[[1]] #> [1] "count" #>  #> $arg[[2]] #> [1] "vernacular_name" #>  #>  #> $value #> $value[[1]] #> [1] 2 #>  #> $value[[2]] #> [1] "Norway Rat" #>  #>  #> $type #> $type[[1]] #> [1] "greaterThanOrEquals" #>  #> $type[[2]] #> [1] "equals" #>  #>  #> $expr #> ((count >= 2) | (vernacular_name == "Norway Rat")) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"  # Use dates as argument start_date <- as.Date("2020-06-03", format = "%Y-%m-%d") end_date <- as.Date("2020-06-10", format = "%Y-%m-%d") pred_or(pred_gte("start", start_date), pred_lte("end", end_date)) #> $arg #> $arg[[1]] #> [1] "start" #>  #> $arg[[2]] #> [1] "end" #>  #>  #> $value #> $value[[1]] #> [1] "2020-06-03" #>  #> $value[[2]] #> [1] "2020-06-10" #>  #>  #> $type #> $type[[1]] #> [1] "greaterThanOrEquals" #>  #> $type[[2]] #> [1] "lessThanOrEquals" #>  #>  #> $expr #> ((start >= lubridate::as_datetime("2020-06-03")) | (end <= lubridate::as_datetime("2020-06-10"))) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"  # Use datetimes (POSIXct) as argument start_date <- lubridate::as_datetime("2020-06-03") end_date <- lubridate::as_datetime("2020-06-10") pred_or(pred_gte("start", start_date), pred_lte("end", end_date)) #> $arg #> $arg[[1]] #> [1] "start" #>  #> $arg[[2]] #> [1] "end" #>  #>  #> $value #> $value[[1]] #> [1] "2020-06-03 UTC" #>  #> $value[[2]] #> [1] "2020-06-10 UTC" #>  #>  #> $type #> $type[[1]] #> [1] "greaterThanOrEquals" #>  #> $type[[2]] #> [1] "lessThanOrEquals" #>  #>  #> $expr #> ((start >= lubridate::as_datetime("2020-06-03")) | (end <= lubridate::as_datetime("2020-06-10"))) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"  # One arg multiple values predicates locations <- c("B_ML_val 03_De Val", "B_ML_val 05_molenkreek") pred_in("location_name", locations) #> $arg #> [1] "location_name" #>  #> $value #> [1] "B_ML_val 03_De Val"     "B_ML_val 05_molenkreek" #>  #> $type #> [1] "in" #>  #> $expr #> (location_name %in% c("B_ML_val 03_De Val","B_ML_val 05_molenkreek")) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_notin("location_name", locations) #> $arg #> [1] "location_name" #>  #> $value #> [1] "B_ML_val 03_De Val"     "B_ML_val 05_molenkreek" #>  #> $type #> [1] "notIn" #>  #> $expr #> (!(location_name %in% c("B_ML_val 03_De Val","B_ML_val 05_molenkreek"))) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" start_dates <- lubridate::as_datetime(c("2020-06-03 20:10:18", "2020-06-03 20:04:33")) pred_in("start", start_dates) #> $arg #> [1] "start" #>  #> $value #> [1] "2020-06-03 20:10:18 UTC" "2020-06-03 20:04:33 UTC" #>  #> $type #> [1] "in" #>  #> $expr #> (start %in% as_datetime(c("2020-06-03 20:10:18","2020-06-03 20:04:33"))) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_notin("start", start_dates) #> $arg #> [1] "start" #>  #> $value #> [1] "2020-06-03 20:10:18 UTC" "2020-06-03 20:04:33 UTC" #>  #> $type #> [1] "notIn" #>  #> $expr #> (!(start %in% as_datetime(c("2020-06-03 20:10:18","2020-06-03 20:04:33")))) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"  # One arg, no value predicates pred_na("scientificName") #> $arg #> [1] "scientificName" #>  #> $value #> [1] NA #>  #> $type #> [1] "na" #>  #> $expr #> (is.na(scientificName)) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate" pred_notna("scientificName") #> $arg #> [1] "scientificName" #>  #> $value #> [1] NA #>  #> $type #> [1] "notNa" #>  #> $expr #> (!is.na(scientificName)) #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "filter_predicate"

what: Get camera operation matrix â€” get_cam_op
title: Get camera operation matrix â€” get_cam_op
text: Returns camera operation matrix returned camtrapR::cameraOperation().

title: Get camera operation matrix â€” get_cam_op
code: get_cam_op(   package = NULL,   ...,   station_col = "locationName",   camera_col = NULL,   session_col = NULL,   use_prefix = FALSE,   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get camera operation matrix â€” get_cam_op
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). ... filter predicates filtering deployments. station_col Column name use identifying stations. Default: "locationName". camera_col Column name column specifying Camera ID. Default: NULL. session_col Column name use identifying session. Default: NULL. Use creating multi-session / multi-season detection histories. use_prefix Logical (TRUE FALSE). TRUE returned row names start prefix "Station" returned camtrapR::cameraOperation(). Default: FALSE. datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get camera operation matrix â€” get_cam_op
text: matrix. Row names always indicate station ID. Column names dates.

title: Get camera operation matrix â€” get_cam_op
text: deployment data default grouped locationName (station ID camtrapR jargon) another column specified user via station_col argument. multiple deployments linked location, daily efforts higher 1 occur. Partially active days, e.g. first last day deployment, result decimal effort values camtrapR::cameraOperation().

title: Get custom effort â€” get_custom_effort
text: Gets effort deployment specific time interval day, week, month year. custom time window can also set . function calls get_cam_op() internally.

title: Get custom effort â€” get_custom_effort
code: get_custom_effort(   package = NULL,   ...,   start = NULL,   end = NULL,   group_by = NULL,   unit = "hour",   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get custom effort â€” get_custom_effort
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). ... filter predicates start Start date. Default: NULL. NULL earliest start date among deployments used. group_by unit NULL, lowest start value allowed one group unit start date earliest deployment. condition hold true, warning returned earliest start date among deployments used. group_by unit NULL start must later equal start date among deployments. end End date. Default: NULL. NULL latest end date among deployments used. group_by unit NULL, latest end value allowed one group unit end date latest deployment. condition hold true, warning returned latest end date among deployments used. group_by unit NULL end must earlier equal end date among deployments. group_by Character, one "day", "week", "month", "year". effort calculated interval rate defined group_by. Default: NULL: grouping, .e. entire interval start end taken account whole. Calendar values used, .e. grouping year calculate effort Jan 1st Dec 31st year. unit Character, time unit use returning custom effort. One : hour (default), day. datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get custom effort â€” get_custom_effort
text: tibble data frame following columns: deploymentID: Deployment unique identifier. locationName: Location name deployments. begin: Begin date interval effort calculated . effort: effort number. unit: Character specifying effort unit.

title: Get custom effort â€” get_custom_effort
code: # Effort for each deployment over the entire duration of the project # (datapackage) measured in hours (default) get_custom_effort(mica) #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 5 #>   deploymentID                         locationName      begin      effort unit  #>   <chr>                                <chr>             <date>      <dbl> <chr> #> 1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beek â€¦ 2019-10-09   239. hour  #> 2 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 B_DL_val 3_dikkeâ€¦ 2019-10-09   219. hour  #> 3 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 B_DM_val 4_'t WAD 2019-10-09   529. hour  #> 4 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 Mica Viane        2019-10-09   335. hour   # Effort for each deployment expressed in days get_custom_effort(mica, unit = "day") #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 5 #>   deploymentID                         locationName      begin      effort unit  #>   <chr>                                <chr>             <date>      <dbl> <chr> #> 1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beek â€¦ 2019-10-09   9.95 day   #> 2 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 B_DL_val 3_dikkeâ€¦ 2019-10-09   9.11 day   #> 3 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 B_DM_val 4_'t WAD 2019-10-09  22.0  day   #> 4 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 Mica Viane        2019-10-09  13.9  day    # Effort for each deployment from a specific start to a specific end get_custom_effort(   mica,   start = as.Date("2019-12-15"), # or lubridate::as_date("2019-12-15")   end = as.Date("2021-01-10") ) #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 5 #>   deploymentID                         locationName      begin      effort unit  #>   <chr>                                <chr>             <date>      <dbl> <chr> #> 1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beek â€¦ 2019-12-15   239. hour  #> 2 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 B_DL_val 3_dikkeâ€¦ 2019-12-15   219. hour  #> 3 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1 B_DM_val 4_'t WAD 2019-12-15     0  hour  #> 4 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7 Mica Viane        2019-12-15     0  hour   # Effort for each deployment at daily interval get_custom_effort(   mica,   group_by = "day" ) #> # A tibble: 2,232 Ã— 5 #>    deploymentID                         locationName     begin      effort unit  #>    <chr>                                <chr>            <date>      <dbl> <chr> #>  1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-09      0 hour  #>  2 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-10      0 hour  #>  3 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-11      0 hour  #>  4 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-12      0 hour  #>  5 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-13      0 hour  #>  6 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-14      0 hour  #>  7 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-15      0 hour  #>  8 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-16      0 hour  #>  9 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-17      0 hour  #> 10 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beekâ€¦ 2019-10-18      0 hour  #> # Applying filter(s), e.g. deployments with latitude >= 51.18, can be # combined with other arguments get_custom_effort(mica, pred_gte("latitude", 51.18), group_by = "month") #> df %>% dplyr::filter((latitude >= 51.18)) #> # A tibble: 6 Ã— 5 #>   deploymentID                         locationName      begin      effort unit  #>   <chr>                                <chr>             <date>      <dbl> <chr> #> 1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beek â€¦ 2020-06-01    0   hour  #> 2 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beek â€¦ 2020-07-01   66.5 hour  #> 3 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 B_DL_val 5_beek â€¦ 2020-08-01  172.  hour  #> 4 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 B_DL_val 3_dikkeâ€¦ 2020-06-01  219.  hour  #> 5 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 B_DL_val 3_dikkeâ€¦ 2020-07-01    0   hour  #> 6 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 B_DL_val 3_dikkeâ€¦ 2020-08-01    0   hour   # You can afterwards calculate the total effort over all deployments library(dplyr) get_custom_effort(mica, group_by = "year", unit = "day") %>%   dplyr::filter(effort > 0) %>%   dplyr::group_by(begin) %>%    dplyr::summarise(     deploymentIDs = list(deploymentID),     locationNames = list(locationName),     ndep = length(unique(deploymentID)),     nloc = length(unique(locationName)),     effort = sum(effort),     unit = unique(unit)   ) #> # A tibble: 3 Ã— 7 #>   begin      deploymentIDs locationNames  ndep  nloc effort unit  #>   <date>     <list>        <list>        <int> <int>  <dbl> <chr> #> 1 2019-01-01 <chr [1]>     <chr [1]>         1     1   13.9 day   #> 2 2020-01-01 <chr [2]>     <chr [2]>         2     2   19.1 day   #> 3 2021-01-01 <chr [1]>     <chr [1]>         1     1   22.0 day

title: Get effort â€” get_effort
text: Gets effort (deployment duration) per deployment.

title: Get effort â€” get_effort
code: get_effort(   package = NULL,   ...,   unit = "hour",   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get effort â€” get_effort
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). ... filter predicates unit Time unit use returning deployment effort (duration). One : second minute hour day month year datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get effort â€” get_effort
text: tibble data frame following columns: deploymentID: Deployment unique identifier. effort: Effort expressed unit passed parameter unit. unit: unit used express effort. One values available parameter unit. effort_duration: duration object (duration class lubridate package).

title: Get effort â€” get_effort
code: # Efforts expressed in hours get_effort(mica) #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 4 #>   deploymentID                         effort unit  effort_duration        #>   <chr>                                 <dbl> <chr> <Duration>             #> 1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8   239. hour  859859s (~1.42 weeks)  #> 2 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372   219. hour  786802s (~1.3 weeks)   #> 3 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1   529. hour  1903602s (~3.15 weeks) #> 4 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7   335. hour  1204929s (~1.99 weeks)  # Effort expressed as days get_effort(mica, unit = "day") #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 4 #>   deploymentID                         effort unit  effort_duration        #>   <chr>                                 <dbl> <chr> <Duration>             #> 1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8   9.95 day   859859s (~1.42 weeks)  #> 2 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372   9.11 day   786802s (~1.3 weeks)   #> 3 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1  22.0  day   1903602s (~3.15 weeks) #> 4 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7  13.9  day   1204929s (~1.99 weeks)

what: Get number of individuals for each deployment â€” get_n_individuals
title: Get number of individuals for each deployment â€” get_n_individuals
text: Gets number individuals (subset species) per deployment. number observed individuals stored field count observations.

title: Get number of individuals for each deployment â€” get_n_individuals
code: get_n_individuals(   package = NULL,   ...,   species = "all",   sex = NULL,   life_stage = NULL,   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get number of individuals for each deployment â€” get_n_individuals
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). ... filter predicates filtering deployments species Character scientific names common names (case insensitive). "" (default) scientific names automatically selected. NULL observations species taken account. sex Character defining sex class filter , e.g. "female" c("male", "unknown"). NULL (default) observations sex classes taken account. life_stage Character vector defining life stage class filter , e.g. "adult" c("subadult", "adult"). NULL (default) observations life stage classes taken account. datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get number of individuals for each deployment â€” get_n_individuals
text: tibble data frame following columns: deploymentID: Deployment unique identifier. scientificName: Scientific name species. column omitted parameter species = NULL. n: Number individuals.

title: Get number of individuals for each deployment â€” get_n_individuals
code: # Get number of observations for each species get_n_individuals(mica) #> # A tibble: 36 Ã— 3 #>    deploymentID                         scientificName         n #>    <chr>                                <chr>              <int> #>  1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Anas strepera          6 #>  2 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Anas platyrhynchos    13 #>  3 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Castor fiber           0 #>  4 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Mustela putorius       0 #>  5 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Vulpes vulpes          0 #>  6 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Martes foina           0 #>  7 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Ardea cinerea          0 #>  8 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Ardea                  0 #>  9 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Homo sapiens           0 #> 10 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 Anas strepera          0 #> # what: Get number of observations for each deployment â€” get_n_obs
title: Get number of observations for each deployment â€” get_n_obs
text: Gets number observations (subset species) per deployment. number observations defined number distinct sequences (sequenceID).

title: Get number of observations for each deployment â€” get_n_obs
code: get_n_obs(   package = NULL,   ...,   species = "all",   sex = NULL,   life_stage = NULL,   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get number of observations for each deployment â€” get_n_obs
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). ... Filter predicates filtering deployments species Character scientific names common names (case insensitive). "" (default) scientific names automatically selected. NULL observations species taken account. sex Character defining sex class filter , e.g. "female" c("male", "unknown"). NULL (default) observations sex classes taken account. life_stage Character vector defining life stage class filter , e.g. "adult" c("subadult", "adult"). NULL (default) observations life stage classes taken account. datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get number of identified species for each deployment â€” get_n_species
code: # Get number of species get_n_species(mica) #> # A tibble: 4 Ã— 2 #>   deploymentID                             n #>   <chr>                                <int> #> 1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8     2 #> 2 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372     4 #> 3 62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1     2 #> 4 7ca633fa-64f8-4cfc-a628-6b0c419056d7     1  # Get number of species for deployments with latitude >= 51.18 get_n_species(mica, pred_gte("latitude", 51.18)) #> df %>% dplyr::filter((latitude >= 51.18)) #> # A tibble: 2 Ã— 2 #>   deploymentID                             n #>   <chr>                                <int> #> 1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8     2 #> 2 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372     4

what: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) â€” get_rai
title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) â€” get_rai
text: Gets RAI (Relative Abundance Index) per deployment. RAI normalized using 100 days deployment activity. words: RAI = 100 * (n/effort) n number observations calculated via get_n_obs() effort effort days calculated via get_effort().

title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) â€” get_rai
code: get_rai(   package = NULL,   ...,   species = "all",   sex = NULL,   life_stage = NULL,   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) â€” get_rai
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). ... Filter predicates filtering deployments. species Character scientific names common names (case insensitive). "" (default) scientific names automatically selected. sex Character defining sex class filter , e.g. "female" c("male", "unknown"). NULL (default) observations sex classes taken account. life_stage Character vector defining life stage class filter , e.g. "adult" c("subadult", "adult"). NULL (default) observations life stage classes taken account. datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) â€” get_rai
text: tibble data frame following columns: - deploymentID: Deployment unique identifier. - scientificName: Scientific name. - rai: Relative abundance index.

title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) â€” get_rai
code: # Calculate RAI for all species get_rai(mica) # species = "all" by default, so equivalent of #> # A tibble: 36 Ã— 3 #>    deploymentID                         scientificName       rai #>    <chr>                                <chr>              <dbl> #>  1 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Anas platyrhynchos  40.2 #>  2 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Anas strepera       30.1 #>  3 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Ardea                0   #>  4 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Ardea cinerea        0   #>  5 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Castor fiber         0   #>  6 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Homo sapiens         0   #>  7 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Martes foina         0   #>  8 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Mustela putorius     0   #>  9 29b7d356-4bb4-4ec4-b792-2af5cc32efa8 Vulpes vulpes        0   #> 10 577b543a-2cf1-4b23-b6d2-cda7e2eac372 Anas platyrhynchos   0   #> # what: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) based on number of individuals â€” get_rai_individuals
title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) based on number of individuals â€” get_rai_individuals
text: Function get RAI (Relative Abundance Index) per deployment based number detected individuals instead number observations. RAI normalized using 100 days deployment activity. words: RAI = 100 * (n/effort) n number individuals calculated via get_n_individuals() effort effort days calculated via get_effort().

title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) based on number of individuals â€” get_rai_individuals
code: get_rai_individuals(   package = NULL,   ...,   species = "all",   sex = NULL,   life_stage = NULL,   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) based on number of individuals â€” get_rai_individuals
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). ... Filter predicates filtering deployments. species Character scientific names common names (case insensitive). "" (default) scientific names automatically selected. sex Character defining sex class filter , e.g. "female" c("male", "unknown"). NULL (default) observations sex classes taken account. life_stage Character vector defining life stage class filter , e.g. "adult" c("subadult", "adult"). NULL (default) observations life stage classes taken account. datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get Relative Abundance Index (RAI) based on number of individuals â€” get_rai_individuals
text: tibble data frame following columns: deploymentID: Deployment unique identifier. scientificName: Scientific name. rai: Relative abundance index.

title: Get record table â€” get_record_table
text: Calculates record table camera trap data package tabulating species records. record table concept developed within camtrapR package, see article. See also function documentation camtrapR::recordTable(). Note: dates times expressed UTC format.

title: Get record table â€” get_record_table
code: get_record_table(   package = NULL,   ...,   stationCol = "locationName",   exclude = NULL,   minDeltaTime = 0,   deltaTimeComparedTo = NULL,   removeDuplicateRecords = TRUE,   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get record table â€” get_record_table
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). ... Filter predicates filtering deployments stationCol Character name column containing stations. Default: "locationName". exclude Character vector species names (scientific names vernacular names) excluded record table. Default: NULL. minDeltaTime Time difference records species station considered independent (minutes). Default: 0. deltaTimeComparedTo One "lastIndependentRecord" "lastRecord". two records considered independent, second one must least minDeltaTime minutes last independent record species (deltaTimeComparedTo = "lastIndependentRecord"), minDeltaTime minutes last record (deltaTimeComparedTo = "lastRecord"). minDeltaTime 0, deltaTimeComparedTo must NULL (default). removeDuplicateRecords Logical. several records species station exactly time, show one? datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get record table â€” get_record_table
text: tibble data frame containing species records additional information stations, date, time metadata, filenames directories images (media) linked species records. details columns returned: Station: Character, station names, found deployment column defined parameter stationCol. Species: Character, scientific name observed species. DateTimeOriginal: Datetime object, found column timestamp observations, UTC format. Date: Date object, date part DateTimeOriginal, UTC format. Time: Character, time part DateTimeOriginal UTC format. delta.time.secs: Numeric, duration seconds previous independent record given species certain location. delta.time.mins: Numeric, duration minutes previous independent record given species certain location. delta.time.hours: Numeric, duration hours previous independent record given species certain location. delta.time.days: Numeric, duration days previous independent record given species certain location. Directory: List, file paths images linked given record, defined column filePath media. Filename: List, file names images linked given record, defined column fileName media.

what: Get scientific name for vernacular name â€” get_scientific_name
title: Get scientific name for vernacular name â€” get_scientific_name
text: Gets scientific name one vernacular names based taxonomic information found metadata (package$taxonomic). match performed case insensitively. vernacular name valid, error returned

title: Get scientific name for vernacular name â€” get_scientific_name
code: get_scientific_name(   package = NULL,   vernacular_name,   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Get scientific name for vernacular name â€” get_scientific_name
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). vernacular_name Character vector input vernacular name(s). datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Get scientific name for vernacular name â€” get_scientific_name
text: Character vector scientific name(s).

title: Get scientific name for vernacular name â€” get_scientific_name
code: # One or more vernacular names get_scientific_name(mica, "beech marten") #> [1] "Martes foina" get_scientific_name(mica, c("beech marten", "mallard")) #> [1] "Martes foina"       "Anas platyrhynchos"  # Vernacular names can be passed in different languages get_scientific_name(mica, c("beech marten", "wilde eend")) #> [1] "Martes foina"       "Anas platyrhynchos"  # Search is performed case insensitively get_scientific_name(mica, c("MaLLarD")) #> [1] "Anas platyrhynchos"  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # An error is returned if at least one invalid vernacular name is passed get_scientfic_name(mica, "this is a bad vernacular name")  # A scientific name is an invalid vernacular name of course get_scientific_name(mica, c("Castor fiber", "wilde eend")) } # }

title: Get species â€” get_species
code: get_species(mica) #> # A tibble: 9 Ã— 5 #>   taxonID taxonIDReference  scientificName vernacularNames.en vernacularNames.nl #>   <chr>   <chr>             <chr>          <chr>              <chr>              #> 1 DGP6    https://www.cataâ€¦ Anas platyrhyâ€¦ mallard            wilde eend         #> 2 DGPL    https://www.cataâ€¦ Anas strepera  gadwall            krakeend           #> 3 32FH    https://www.cataâ€¦ Ardea          great herons       reigers            #> 4 GCHS    https://www.cataâ€¦ Ardea cinerea  grey heron         blauwe reiger      #> 5 RQPW    https://www.cataâ€¦ Castor fiber   Eurasian beaver    bever              #> 6 6MB3T   https://www.cataâ€¦ Homo sapiens   human              mens               #> 7 3Y9VW   https://www.cataâ€¦ Martes foina   beech marten       steenmarter        #> 8 44QYC   https://www.cataâ€¦ Mustela putorâ€¦ European polecat   bunzing            #> 9 5BSG3   https://www.cataâ€¦ Vulpes vulpes  red fox            vos

title: Visualize deployments features â€” map_dep
text: function visualizes deployments features number detected species, number observations RAI dynamic map. circle size colour proportional mapped feature. Deployments without observations shown gray circles message returned.

title: Visualize deployments features â€” map_dep
code: map_dep(   package = NULL,   feature,   ...,   species = NULL,   sex = NULL,   life_stage = NULL,   effort_unit = NULL,   cluster = TRUE,   hover_columns = c("n", "species", "deploymentID", "locationID", "locationName",     "latitude", "longitude", "start", "end"),   palette = "inferno",   zero_values_show = TRUE,   zero_values_icon_url = "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/000000/multiply.png",   zero_values_icon_size = 10,   na_values_show = TRUE,   na_values_icon_url = "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/FA5252/multiply.png",   na_values_icon_size = 10,   relative_scale = TRUE,   max_scale = NULL,   radius_range = c(10, 50),   datapkg = lifecycle::deprecated() )

title: Visualize deployments features â€” map_dep
text: package Camera trap data package object, returned read_camtrap_dp(). feature Deployment feature visualize. One : n_species: Number identified species. n_obs: Number observations. n_individuals: Number individuals. rai: Relative Abundance Index. rai_individuals: Relative Abundance Index based number individuals. effort: Effort (duration) deployment. ... Filter predicates subsetting deployments. species Character scientific name. Required rai, optional n_obs. Default: NULL. sex Character defining sex class filter , e.g. "female". NULL (default) observations sex classes taken account. Optional parameter n_obs n_individuals. life_stage Character vector defining life stage class filter , e.g. "adult" c("subadult", "adult"). NULL (default) observations life stage classes taken account. Optional parameter n_obs n_individuals. effort_unit Time unit use visualizing deployment effort (duration). One : second minute hour day month year  NULL (default), effort returned hours. cluster Logical value indicating whether using cluster option visualizing maps. Default: TRUE. hover_columns Character vector name columns use showing location deployment information mouse hover. One deployment columns. Use NULL disable hovering. Default information: n: Number species, number observations, RAI effort (column created internally get_*() function). species: Species name(s). start: Start deployment. end: End deployment. deploymentID: Deployment unique identifier. locationID: Location unique identifier. locationName: Location name. latitude longitude See Deployment section Camtrap DP full list columns can use. palette palette name colour function values mapped . Typically one following: character vector RGB named colours. Examples: c("#000000",   "#0000FF", "#FFFFFF")),topo.colors(10)). full name RColorBrewer palette, e.g. "BuPu" "Greens", viridis palette: "viridis", "magma", "inferno" "plasma". options, see parameter palette leaflet::colorNumeric(). zero_values_show Logical indicating whether show deployments zero values. Default: TRUE. zero_values_icon_url Character URL icon showing deployments zero values. Default: cross (multiply symbol) "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/000000/multiply.png". zero_values_icon_size number set size icon show deployments zero values. Default: 10. na_values_show Logical indicating whether show deployments zero values. Notice feature "n_species" generates NA values. Default: TRUE. na_values_icon_url Character URL icon showing deployments NA values. Notice feature "n_species" generates NA values. Default: red cross (multiply symbol) "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/FA5252/multiply.png". na_values_icon_size number set size icon show deployments NA values. Notice feature "n_species" generates NA values. Default: 10. relative_scale Logical indicating whether use relative colour radius scale (TRUE) absolute scale (FALSE). absolute scale used, specify valid max_scale. max_scale Number indicating max value used map colour radius. radius_range Vector length 2 containing lower upper limit circle radius. lower value used deployments zero feature value, .e. observations, identified species, zero RAI zero effort. upper value used deployment(s) highest feature value (relative_scale = TRUE) max_scale (relative_scale = FALSE). Default: c(10, 50). datapkg Deprecated. Use package instead.

title: Visualize deployments features â€” map_dep
text: Leaflet map.

title: Visualize deployments features â€” map_dep
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Show number of species map_dep(   mica,   "n_species" )  # Show number of observations (observations of unidentified species included # if any) map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs" )  # Show number of observations of Anas platyrhynchos map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   species = "Anas platyrhynchos" )  # Show number of observations of subadult individuals of Anas strepera map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   species = "Anas strepera",   life_stage = "subadult" )  # Show number of observations of female or unknown individuals of gadwall map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   species = "gadwall",   sex = c("female", "unknown") )  # Show number of individuals (individuals of unidentified species included if # any) map_dep(   mica,   "n_individuals" )  # Same filters by life stage and sex as for number of observations apply map_dep(   mica,   "n_individuals",   species = "Anas strepera",   sex = "female",   life_stage = "adult" )  # Show RAI map_dep(   mica,   "rai",   species = "Anas strepera" )  # Same filters by life_stage and sex as for number of observations apply map_dep(   mica,   "rai",   species = "Anas strepera",   sex = "female",   life_stage = "adult" )  # Show RAI calculated by using number of detected individuals map_dep(   mica,   "rai_individuals",   species = "Anas strepera" )  # Same filters by life stage and sex as for basic RAI apply map_dep(   mica,   "rai_individuals",   species = "Anas strepera",   sex = "female",   life_stage = "adult" )  # Show effort (hours) map_dep(   mica,   "effort" ) # Show effort (days) map_dep(   mica,   "effort",   effort_unit = "day" )  # Use viridis palette (viridis palettes) map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   palette = "viridis" )  # Use "BuPu" colour palette (RColorBrewer palettes) map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   palette = "BuPu" )  # Use a palette defined by colour names map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   palette = c("black", "blue", "white") )  # Use a palette defined by hex colours map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   palette = c("#000000", "#0000FF", "#FFFFFF") )  # Do not show deployments with zero values map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = "subadult",   zero_values_show = FALSE )  # Use same icon but but a non default colour for zero values deployments, # e.g. red (hex: E74C3C) map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = "subadult",   zero_values_icon_url = "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/E74C3C/multiply.png" )  # ... or yellow (F1C40F) map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = "subadult",   zero_values_icon_url = "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/F1C40F/multiply.png" )  # Use another icon via a different URL, e.g. the character Fry from Futurama # in green (2ECC71) map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = "subadult",   zero_values_icon_url = "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/2ECC71/futurama-fry.png" )  # Same behavior for the icon visualizing NA values (`"n_species"` feature) unknown_species_vs_no_obs <- mica unknown_species_vs_no_obs$data$observations <-    unknown_species_vs_no_obs$data$observations %>%    # a deployment has detected only unknown species   filter(is.na(.data$scientificName) |             .data$scientificName != "Homo sapiens") %>%   # a deployment has no observations   filter(deploymentID != "62c200a9-0e03-4495-bcd8-032944f6f5a1") # create new map map_dep(   unknown_species_vs_no_obs,   feature = "n_species",   zero_values_icon_url = "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/2ECC71/futurama-fry.png",   zero_values_icon_size = 60,   na_values_icon_url = "https://img.icons8.com/ios-glyphs/30/E74C3C/futurama-fry.png",   na_values_icon_size = 60 )  # Set size of the icon for zero values deployments map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   life_stage = "subadult",   zero_values_icon_size = 30 )  # Disable cluster map_dep(   mica,   "n_species",   cluster = FALSE )  # Show only number of observations and location name while hovering map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   hover_columns = c("locationName", "n") )  # Use absolute scale for colours and radius map_dep(mica,   "n_species",   relative_scale = FALSE,   max_scale = 4 )  # Change max and min size circles map_dep(   mica,   "n_obs",   radius_range = c(40, 150) ) } # }

title: Transform Camtrap DP data to Darwin Core â€” write_dwc
text: Data transformed Occurrence core Audubon Media Description extension. follows recommendations discussed created Peter Desmet, John Wieczorek, Lien Reyserhove, Ben Norton others. following terms set package metadata: datasetName: Title provided package$title. datasetID: Identifier provided package$id. Can DOI. rightsHolder: Rights holder provided package$rightsHolder. collectionCode: Platform name provided package$platform$title. license: License scope data provided package$licenses. rights media files: License scope media provided package$licenses. dwc:dataGeneralizations: "coordinates rounded package$coordinatePrecision degree". coordinatePrecision: package$coordinatePrecision (e.g. 0.001). Key features Darwin Core transformation: Deployments (camera traps) parent events, observations (machine observations) child events. information parent event provided ID, meaning data can expressed Occurrence Core one row per observation parentEventID shared occurrences deployment. Sequence-based observations share eventID per sequence, image-based observations share eventID per image. image(s) observation based provided Audubon Media Description extension, foreign key observation. Excluded records document blank unclassified media, vehicles observations humans.

NULL, EML object returned instead, can useful extended/adapting EML writing EML::write_eml(). title Dataset title. description Dataset description. added automatically generated paragraph. Multiple paragraphs can provided character vector. creators Dataset creators NULL package$contributors added creators, order listed. e.g. c("Emma Cartuyvels", "Jim Casaer", "...", "Peter Desmet"), Emma Cartuyvels, Jim Casaer Peter Desmet set first, second last creators respectively, condition name (title) present package$contributors. contributors inserted "...", sorted last name. keywords Dataset keywords.

title: Transform Camtrap DP metadata to EML â€” write_eml

title: Transform Camtrap DP metadata to EML â€” write_eml
text: Metadata derived provided package function parameters. following properties set: title: Title provided title package$title. description: Description provided description package$description. description preceded automatically generated paragraph describing project platform dataset derived, extend coordinates rounded (package$coordinatePrecision). license: License scope data provided package$licenses. creators: Contributors (roles) provided package$contributors, filtered/reordered based creators. contact: First creator. metadata provider: First creator. keywords: Keywords provided keywords. associated parties: Organizations provided package$organizations. geographic coverage: Bounding box provided package$spatial. taxonomic coverage: Species (ranks) provided package$taxonomic. temporal coverage: Date range provided package$temporal. project data: Title, acronym identifier, description, sampling design provided package$project. first creator set project personnel. alternative identifier: Identifier provided package$id. DOI, new DOI created publishing GBIF. external link: URL project provided package$project$path. set manually GBIF IPT: type, subtype, update frequency publishing organization. set: sampling methods citations. applicable: collection data.

title: camtraptor 0.26.0
text: get_custom_effort() returns now effort deployment separately (#333). returned data frame two new columns: deploymentID locationName.

title: camtraptor 0.25.0
text: read_camtrap_dp() detects Camtrap DP version package$profile using regex (#295). supports reading Camtrap DPs created GBIF IPT.

title: camtraptor 0.24.0
text: Replicate old Camtrap DP 0.1.6 behaviour populate angle radius event-based observations. Values taken first media-based observation (fields individualPositionRadius individualPositionAngle) eventID/individualID combination (#291).

title: camtraptor 0.23.0
text: Fix bug read_camtrap_dp() reading Camtrap DP 1.0 (#292).

title: camtraptor 0.22.0
text: Fix bug write_eml() Camtrap DP 1.0 datasets (#290). read_camtrap_dp() now always populate taxonID package.taxonomy (#290).

title: camtraptor 0.21.0
text: read_camtrap_dp() supports Camtrap DP 1.0 (upcoming Agouti export format) favour Camtrap DP 1.0-rc.1 (#284). avoid breaking changes users, -convert Camtrap DP 1.0 0.1.6 currently used internal data model camtraptor. get_custom_effort() now calculates per calendar month/week (#219). write_dwc() updated mapping dwc_audubon.csv (#274). get_record_table() returns number observed individuals (#279). get_cam_op() allows add session camera IDs station names output (#288).
